ingredients: 2  onions,4 cloves garlic,thumb sized  ginger,300 g red lentis,2 tbsp sunflower oil,5  curry leaves,1 tsp mustard seeds,1 tsp cumin seeds,1 tsp coriander powder,1 tsp turmeric,1  dried chilli,1 tbsp tomato purée,400 g coconut milk,850 ml water,some  coriander,some  sliced green chilli
cooklang:
Finely slice the @onions{2}, crush or finely chop the @garlic{4%cloves} and finely chop the @ginger{thumb sized}.

Rinse the @red lentis{300%g} until the water runs clear, then drain.

Heat the @sunflower oil{2%tbsp} in a #large, shallow pan{} and cook the onions over a low heat for 10 mins until starting to brown, adding more oil if the pan looks dry.

Add the garlic and ginger, and cook for another 30 seconds.

Scatter in @curry leaves{5}, if using, then add @mustard seeds{1%tsp}, @cumin seeds{1%tsp}, @coriander powder{1%tsp}, @turmeric{1%tsp}, @dried chilli{1} and cook for a few minutes more.

Stir in @tomato purée{1%tbsp} and cook for 1 minute longer.

Stir in the red lentils, ensuring they’re well coated in the spices, then pour over the @coconut milk{400%g} and @water{850%ml}.

Bring to the boil, stirring occasionally, then simmer for about 30 mins until the lentils are soft and soupy.

Scoop out the whole chilli and discard, then season generously with salt.

Serve with a sprinkling of the @coriander{}, sliced ginger and @sliced green chilli{}, and drizzle with a bit more oil.

The dhal can now be left to cool, then frozen in portions, or as one batch in a large plastic container. Defrost completely before reheating in a pan over a low heat, adding more water to loosen if needed.

name: Classic Jacket Potatoes
method: Heat the oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Rub the olive oil over the potatoes and put on the top shelf of the oven.Bake for 20 mins. Turn down the oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5 and bake for 45 mins-1 hr until the skin is crisp and the flesh soft. Cut a cross on top of each potato, squeeze the sides, add the soured cream and your favourite toppings
ingredients: some  olive oil,some  salt,3 large baking potatoes
cooklang:
Heat the #oven{} to 220°C / 200°C fan / gas 7.

Rub @olive oil{} and @salt{} over @baking potatoes{3%large} and put directly on the top shelf of the oven. Bake for ~{20%minutes}.

Turn down the oven to 190C / 170°C fan / gas 5 and bake for ~{45%minutes} up to an hour, until the skin is crisp and the flesh soft.

Cut a cross on top of each potato, squeeze the sides, add the soured cream and your favourite toppings.

name: keema matar
method: If your mustard seed, cumin seed, and peppercorns are whole, crush those down in a mortar and pestle or spice grinder. .Leave the cinnamon stick, cloves, & bay leaf whole to remove them at the end of cooking..Grate (or finely dice) the tomatoes and set them aside. .Soften the ground beef: Add the ground beef to a bowl and mix in about 50
ingredients: 2.5 grams  mustard seeds,2.5 grams  cumin seeds,1 gram  black peppercorns,1 bay leaf  bay leaf,2 cloves  cloves,1 stick  cinnamon,2.5 grams  ground cayenne powder,2.5 grams  ground turmeric root,1 sprinkle  salt,150 grams  onion,12 grams  serrano peppers,10 grams  garlic,7.5 grams  ginger,200 grams  roma tomatoes,450 grams  ground meat,250 milliliters  water,30 grams  cilantro,30 milliliters  avocado oil,some  &(=1)whole and freshly ground spices,some  &(=2)aromatics,some  &(=1)ground spices,some  &(=2)grated tomato,some  &(=2)liquid ground meat,1 sprinkle  &salt,200 grams  frozen peas,1 spritz  lemon juice,1 sprinkle  garam masala,some  &(=3)chopped cilantro
cooklang:
> Minced meat cooked with onions, tomatoes, and spices.

= Prepare spices

Grind @mustard seeds{2.5 grams}, @cumin seeds{2.5 grams}, @black peppercorns{1 gram} together in a mortar and pestle and set aside in a small bowl.

Add a @bay leaf{1 bay leaf}, @cloves{2 cloves}, and @cinnamon{1 stick} to the same bowl.

Set aside @ground cayenne powder{2.5 grams}, @ground turmeric root{2.5 grams}, and @salt{1 sprinkle} in another small bowl.

= Prepare aromatics

Mince half an @onion{150 grams}(or half an onion) and @serrano peppers{12 grams}(whole, about 2 peppers) as small as possible.

Grate @garlic{10 grams}(about 2 cloves) and @ginger{7.5 grams}(about 1 inch) with a box grater.

Set aside all aromatics together in a bowl.

= Prepare sauce base

Grate @roma tomatoes{200 grams}(about two tomatoes) and set aside in a small bowl.

Add @ground meat{450 grams}(beef, lamb, or chicken) to a bowl and add about a cup of @water{250 milliliters}. Mix the meat until it's smooth and the all clumps are broken up.

Remove the base of @cilantro{30 grams}(about 1 bunch) stems, and wash and roughly chop the leaves and stems.

= Cooking

Heat a @avocado oil{30 milliliters} in a large pan over medium heat.

Add the @&(=1)whole and freshly ground spices{} and toast for ~{10-20 seconds}.

Add the @&(=2)aromatics{} and cook down for ~{6-8%minutes}, until "your kitchen starts to smell magical".

Add the @&(=1)ground spices{} and the @&(=2)grated tomato{} and cook for another ~{5%minutes} until "a sauce has formed and it has started to darken a bit".

Add the @&(=2)liquid ground meat{} along with @&salt{1 sprinkle} and while stirring occasionally, cook for another ~{5-10%minutes}, "until everything gets comfy with each other".

Once the meat is cooked through, add @frozen peas{200 grams} and stir until cooked through.

Add @lemon juice{1 spritz} and @garam masala{1 sprinkle} and stir to combine.

Garnish with @&(=3)chopped cilantro{}.
